flow.descriptionCdata:
a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.02cf29d7-65bc-4d8e-8bb3-167a62ba078a.prompt=Process Instance ID a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.2d2b505b-bd60-423d-a1c6-0c8ee94fe649.prompt=User Identifier a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.3f629481-6849-43d9-bb6a-cfefc007cc5e.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.42de5b8e-830a-47b3-80c7-9283ac4c83ad.prompt=User Identifier a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.6ef62941-38a0-45e5-840c-23c391c33c09.prompt=User Identifier a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.7709c687-16a8-42d6-8374-0a523e6f0467.prompt=Process Instance ID a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.98de60a3-de2d-487f-827c-3253e4b4a09d.prompt=Resource Provider ID a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.a46e9ee6-b158-40e1-8e77-5b9eb49bacc0.prompt=Artifact ID a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.bcdb6ee1-6af6-4c38-9502-53e2993e6e0c.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.be2cb7ff-8cda-4e6a-a873-c578fe4ffcde.description=This workflow adds/ updates the component properties to Instance using Artifact APIs. onlyUpdate\: yes/no yes - To update values of existing properties no - To add and/or update properties keyValuePairs\: If you want to Add/update new properties\: property1 PUBLIC INTEGER 5 property2 PUBLIC STRING abc xyz If you want to only update the values of existing properties\: property1 5 property2 abc xyz a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.description=
This flow will flex up or flex down the cpu and memory configuration of all the servers in a server group. 

The flex up and flex down operations will execute whether the server is running, suspended or in switched off state.
If the flex up or flex down operation fails for one server, the action will continue on the remaining servers in the server group.
The maximum number that can be given as input for a flex up operation depends on the underlying configured vCenter.

Inputs\:
CSA_CONTEXT_ID 	\: CSA Context Id
CSA_PROCESS_ID 	\: CSA Process Instance Id
SVC_COMPONENT_ID 	\: This token will resolve to the Service component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:SVC_COMPONENT_ID]
RSC_PROVIDER_ID 	\: This token will resolve to the Resource Provider Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:RSC_PROVIDER_ID]
SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL \: This token will resolve to the subscriber’s email address. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL]
RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID 	\: This token will resolve to the Resource Subscription Id that was created from the Resource Offering at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE 	\: This token will resolve to the Service component type. Eg\: Server.. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE]
RSC_POOL_ID 	\: This token will resolve to the Resource pool Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_POOL_ID]
SVC_INSTANCE_ID 	\: This token will resolve to the Service Instance Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_INSTANCE_ID]
SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID 	\: This token will resolve to the Subscription Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
PRN_COMPONENT_ID 	\: This token will resolve to the parent Component’s Service Component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: PRN_COMPONENT_ID]
REQ_ORG_ID 	\: This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_ORG_ID]
REQ_USER_ID 	\: This token will resolve to the User Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_USER_ID]
USR_ORG_ID 	\: This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the subscriber. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: USR_ORG_ID]
RSC_BINDING_ID 	\: This token will resolve to the Resource Binding Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_BINDING_ID]

These tokens with the default values are resolved by CSA when the flow is invoked.

Responses\:
success		\: The flex up/flex down operation succeeded on all servers of the server group
failure		\: The flex up/flex down operation may have failed on one or more servers of the server group
a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.df2bdb39-54c6-48d1-8df8-766fb7647072.prompt=User Identifier a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.e406a17a-ecb8-472e-9e0c-b662af1be9e2.prompt=User Identifier a5dadf60-e111-4d2b-8fe6-e90aaf1c1a54.e504de3a-dcb3-413a-9f60-027a9ed39590.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........
flow.name: Azure- Update Server Deployed
